text: Patrick Conway Brown (January 11, 1917, Vankleek Hill, Ontario - June 3, 1996) was a professional ice hockey player who played 93 games in the National Hockey League with the Detroit Red Wings. He won one Stanley Cup with the Wings in 1943 and ended his hockey career after playing for the Glace Bay Miners in the late 1940s. He was born in Vankleek Hill, Ontario.
